topics.body:
So apparently some dude won a world pokemon competition using a pachirisu.

Moral of the story: if your entire gaming skills rely on flow charts and such you're going to get your ass kicked when someone pulls a gimmick you've never seen or encountered and you don't know how to expect the unexpected.  In other words, "Get legitimately gud".

Side note: I found this out because people are getting 200% super butthurt about it.

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53f1804a63687211ee5e0000#post_53f1804a63687211ee5e0000
If you think that's mean spirited you should hear me tear the living fuck out of whenever finding bugs in games/criticizing video game mechanics.

"This piece of shit is nothing more than a call of duty clone gameplay wise just with different guns.  Name one fucking thing that differentiates it game mechanic wise from call of duty. . . Oh so you're trying to pander to the FPS crowd; I think you mean the prepubescent squeaker crowd that their mom only bought the game for them cause they wouldn't shut up and that the kid only wants the game to be one of the 'cool' kids, but you could never compete with cause the children are only playing the game cause they're trying to be cool so therefore they won't buy your game. . . Well maybe if you tried to make the game good people would actually be interested in it. . . This game is so fucking unfinished that EA is trying to publish it. . . You could easily fix the clipping problem if you would just have a grid pattern that the character can move around in. . . Stop trying to put in a million fucking guns for only three character classes; the more weapons and shit there is in the game the harder to balance it is and the more time you have to spend balancing the shit."
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
